snippet: President Obama stiffened his pledge to prevent Iran from acquiring nuclear weapons but said he would try to convince Israel that a premature assault could strengthen Iran.
abstract: Pres Obama stiffens his pledge to prevent Iran from acquiring nuclear weapons but says he will try to convince Israel that a premature assault could strengthen Iran by allowing it to portray itself as a victim of aggression; says such military action will only delay, not prevent, Iran's acquisition of nuclear weapons.

byline.contributor: Elisabeth Bumiller and David E. Sanger contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: President Obama stiffened his pledge to prevent Iran from acquiring nuclear weapons but said he would try to convince Israel that a premature assault could strengthen Iran.

headline.seo: Obama Says Military Option on Iran Not a ‘Bluff’
headline.main: Obama Says Iran Strike Is an Option, but Warns Israel
headline.print_headline: Obama Says Option to Strike Iran Not a ‘Bluff,’ but Cites Repercussions

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
keywords.name: subject
